metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25692 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference was found in OpenLDAP server and was fixed in openldap 2.4.55, during a request for renaming RDNs. An unauthenticated attacker could remotely crash the slapd process by sending a specially crafted request, causing a Denial of Service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.10
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.10
slapd - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.10
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openldap package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.10').
